general_advisory: Farmers should maintain standing water to a depth of 2-3 cm for at least 2-3 days before uprooting of seedlings. Irrigate fields due to mildly dry conditions. Management advice for various crops including sprays, fertilization, and pest control.

advisory: Use Trichogramma japonicum cards for stem borer management
Apply pest control agents like Cartap Hydrochloride or Chlorantraniliprole
Use Validamycin 3% L or Captan + Hexaconazole for stem rot management
Select resistant varieties for red rot disease prevention
Treat setts with a solution of carbendazim, chlorpyriphos, and urea
Use sprays like Sulphur 80% WP or Hexaconazole for powdery mildew management
Spray Chlorpyriphos + Cypermethrin for cut worm control
Use Ethion or Spiromesifen for mite control
Manage aphid infestation with neem oil or Flonicam sprays
Spray Mancozeb or Difenoconazole for purple blotch and leaf blight management
Control black spot disease with Copper Oxychloride spray
Maintain water depth to 6 ft for fish hibernation
